Detailed Description

Internal implementation of an OBEX Server Registry.

Warning;
This is an internal interface which must not be used outside APOXI OBEX at all.

In order to facilitate dispatching of incoming requests by TARGET header, MIME type and possibly other criteria servers must register with a central Server Registry. This registry assigns each server a system-wide unique id, the ObexServerId. Furthermore, it provides the infrastructure for mapping incoming requests onto server id's by employing a Visitor Pattern. Internally, server records are kept in a list sorted by ascending ObexServerId values.

The Server Registry is represented by an instance of this class which can be accessed by calling ObexMngr::GetServerMngr().

See also:

void ObexServerMngr::Deregister (  ObexServerInfo &  server_info  ) 
 

Remove a registered server from the Server Registry.

Parameters:
server_info ObexServerInfo record of the server to be removed from the registry.

ObexServerId ObexServerMngr::Iterate (  ObexServerVisitor &  visitor  ) 
 

Iterate over the Server Registry visiting entries.

Visits entries of the Server Registry until ObexServerInfo::Accept() returns 'TRUE'. In this case, the ObexServerId of that entry is returned, otherwise the method returns ObexServerInfo::NoServerId.

Parameters:
visitor Visitor instance to be applied to Server Registry entries.
Returns:
ObexServerId of the server record whose Accept() method returned TRUE.

ObexServerId ObexServerMngr::Register (  ObexServerInfo &  info_item,
ObexServerVisitor &  checker,
ObexServerId  special_id
) 
 

Registers a server with the Server Registry.

Parameters:
info_item ObexServerInfo record of the server to be registered.
checker Visitor instance to check for server ambiguity.
special_id ObexServerId proposed for this server, this is necessary for handling special cases like OPP dispatching (based on MIME types) and default INBOX For servers using directed connections, pass ObexServerInfo::FirstServerId
